Sentencas: The kinetics of the non-catalytic gas-solid reaction between MnOx/gamma-Al(2)O(3 )and SO2 were investigated.
Titulo: Kinetic study of SO2 adsorption on microfibrous entrapped sorbents for solid oxide fuel cell cathode protection

Sentencas: A mathematical model based on axial dispersion, external and internal diffusion resistance, as well as a depletion mechanism for the sorbent has been established in this study.
Titulo: Kinetic study of SO2 adsorption on microfibrous entrapped sorbents for solid oxide fuel cell cathode protection

Sentencas: It predicted the breakthrough curves of packed bed (PB) and microfibrous entrapped sorbent (MFES) with acceptable deviations.
Titulo: Kinetic study of SO2 adsorption on microfibrous entrapped sorbents for solid oxide fuel cell cathode protection

Sentencas: This model consists of two predetermined parameters: the initial sorption rate constant (k(o)) and the depletion rate constant (k(d)), which can be determined by fitting the model to experimental data at various temperatures.
Titulo: Kinetic study of SO2 adsorption on microfibrous entrapped sorbents for solid oxide fuel cell cathode protection

Sentencas: Due to the uniform flow pattern and minimized bed channeling, MFES outperformed conventional PB consisting of the same sorbent particle size in terms of the reduction in SO2 concentration.
Titulo: Kinetic study of SO2 adsorption on microfibrous entrapped sorbents for solid oxide fuel cell cathode protection

Sentencas: The MFES surpassed PB significantly during the in situ regeneration in anode exhaust gas (AEG).
Titulo: Kinetic study of SO2 adsorption on microfibrous entrapped sorbents for solid oxide fuel cell cathode protection

Sentencas: Furthermore, MFES maintained its high breakthrough capacity up to five adsorption/regeneration cycles.
Titulo: Kinetic study of SO2 adsorption on microfibrous entrapped sorbents for solid oxide fuel cell cathode protection

Sentencas: Therefore, the MFES is a superior approach to remove the potential SO2 from the fuel cell cathode air stream for practical applications.
Titulo: Kinetic study of SO2 adsorption on microfibrous entrapped sorbents for solid oxide fuel cell cathode protection
